channel.title: Drinking age from 21 to 18
channel.description:
I just read an article that many college presidents are trying to get lawmakers to lower the legal drinking age from 21 to 18. They think it will cut down on dangerous binge drinking on campus.
Now, i'm not sure. I just turned 21 not even a month ago, and i drink just as much now, if not more, then between 18-21. But i also just turned 21, so maybe once that "new-ness" wore off it would curb the drinking.
What do you guys think?

item.title: Drinking age from 21 to 18
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

xEnt:

Move to Australia and enjoy the benefits.

lol.

It can either work totally for them, or totally against them. I call for them only because i want it to happen lol. But really it would sort of put rebellion drinking away and make the drinking less exciting. I guess you could say that drinking illegally is more exciting than drinking legally. unless you’re paranoid.

Read full topic

item.title: Drinking age from 21 to 18
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:11, topic:226870”][quote author=Niall link=topic=298134.msg2397260#msg2397260 date=1219237906]
In the UK, drinking under 5 years of age is permitted when it’s for medicinal purposes, after that you’re allowed to drink at home from the age of 5 with parent’s consent, and 16 in pubs/restaurants when parents consent is given(must be ordered with a meal iirc).

GG guys.
[/quote]

You can drink beer/cider with a meal under 16 with parents permission. Over 16, you don’t need permission to drink beer/cider with a meal.[/quote]

Quoted from a breeze-block of a law book:

“The offence(about giving children alcohol on a premises) does not apply to persons of sixteen or seventeen who consume beer, wine or cider with a table meal on a licensed etc premises and are accompanied by a person of eighteen or over”

Read full topic

item.title: Drinking age from 21 to 18
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:10, topic:226870”]In the UK, drinking under 5 years of age is permitted when it’s for medicinal purposes, after that you’re allowed to drink at home from the age of 5 with parent’s consent, and 16 in pubs/restaurants when parents consent is given(must be ordered with a meal iirc).

GG guys.[/quote]

You can drink beer/cider with a meal under 16 with parents permission. Over 16, you don’t need permission to drink beer/cider with a meal.

In practise though, you don’t drink until you’re 18 in a pub, the pubs are too scared of fucking up and being fined thousands of pounds to do the law properly.

Read full topic

item.title: Drinking age from 21 to 18
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

xEnt:

Move to Australia and enjoy the benefits.

Yeah, not sure about other countries but it’s 18 here. You’re legally allowed to drink when you’re 16 as long as you’re under your parents supervision.

Read full topic

item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“army_life, post:5, topic:226870”]no its not who told you that?

Acid or C.M is…[/quote]

Acid doesn’t do you any physical harm, and unless you have a mental disorder it won’t do you any mental harm either. And I’m assuming C.M is cough medicine?
